headline: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

headline: Bloom Energy Is Already the Fuel-Cell King. It’s Setting Its Sights Much Higher.
summary: Bloom Energy’s  latest earnings report cemented its status as a major data-center power player, highlighting how it isn’t a niche clean-energy company anymore.  The maker of fuel cells is aiming to take market share from companies such as  GE Vernova  the big dogs of power production.  Bloom Energy stock rose 2% in early trading Friday as investors parsed its fourth-quarter financial results, disclosed late Thursday.

headline: Xcel Energy pursuing large load tariffs in 4 states amid data center growth
summary: The company expects to sign contracts on 6 GW of data centers by the end of 2027, CEO Bob Frenzel said. Xcel is partnering with NextEra Energy and GE Vernova to speed its development of new generation.

headline: Xcel Energy Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Xcel Energy (NASDAQ:XEL) reported 2025 ongoing earnings of $3.80 per share, up from $3.50 per share in 2024, as leadership highlighted stronger rate outcomes, sales growth, and a growing pipeline of large-load and transmission opportunities. Management also reaffirmed 2026 earnings guidance of $4.04

headline: 1 Industrials Stock to Own for Decades and 2 We Question
summary: Whether you see them or not, industrials businesses play a crucial part in our daily activities. But their prominence also brings high exposure to the ups and downs of economic cycles. Luckily, the tide is turning in their favor as the industry’s 21% return over the past six months has topped the S&P 500 by 12.5 percentage points.

headline: Has GE Vernova (GEV) Run Too Far After 97% One Year Share Price Surge
summary: If you are wondering whether GE Vernova's share price still makes sense after its run so far, the key question now is how that price compares with the underlying value of the business. The stock last closed at US$737.53, with returns of 2.8% over 7 days, 7.5% over 30 days, 8.5% year to date and 97.2% over the past year, which raises questions about how much of the story is already reflected in the price. Recent company updates and ongoing attention around the business have kept GE Vernova on...
